src_text: Kabinete e kopane ka Laboraro la 5 Lewedi 2018 ka Tuynhuys, Motsekap Merero ye bohlokwa seemong sa bjale1.
trg_text: Cabinet met on Wednesday, 5 September 2018 at Tuynhuys, Cape Tow

src_text: Ekonomi Kabinete e ipilet a go mafapha ka moka a Afrika Borwa go thekga masolo a mmu o a go thekga kgolo ya ekonomi ka morago ga go lokollwa ga dipalopalo t eo di laet ago gore ekonomi ya rena e phuhlame ka palo ya lefeela fegelwana
trg_text: Cabinet calls on all sectors of South Africa to rally behind government-led initiatives to boost economic growth following the release of growth figures showing our economy contracted by zero point 7 per cent in the second quarter from a revised -percent in the first quarte Although some sectors of the economy, such as mining, construction and finance, recorded an improvement in growth, this was insufficient to offset fully the contraction in other sectors, in particular the agricultural secto

src_text: upa ya dipersente ka kotareng ya bobedi go tloga go - ye e bu eledit wego ka kotareng ya mathom Le ge e le gore mafapha a mangwe a ekonomi, a go swana le la meepo, kago le la dit helete a hwedit e kaonafalo ya kgolo, se ga se sa lekana go kaonafat a go phuhlama ka mafapheng a mangwe, kudukudu ka lefapheng la tem Ka lehlakoreng la t homi o ya dit helete, palomoka ya diromelwantle e bile le tlhatlogo ye maatla, le ge go le bjale se se nyefi it we ke go phuhlama ga t homi o ya dit helete ka malapeng le go theoga kudu ga dithot Kgolo ya dipeelet o ka dikhamphani t a phraebete e oket egile, le ge e le gore peelet o ka lefapha la set haba e phuhlamil Tlhatlogo ya tlhokego ya bonnete ka mebarakeng ya lefase ka bophara le ka poelong ya Palomoka ya Letseno la Dit welet wa t a ka Nageng (GDP) e nyaka gore mmu o o akgofi e maitapi o a go fedi a mathata a kgolo ya ekonomi mola ka go le lengwe o aba thekgo go dihlopha t eo di lego kotsin Kgolo ya ekonomi e nant e kudu mo mengwageng ye e fetilego ye men Se se laet a mabaka a go swana le maemo a komelello ka lefapheng la temo le ditheko t a fase t a dit welet wa eup a gape le mathata a peakanyo ka mo nageng, ao a
trg_text: Economic growth has slowed down significantly over the last four year This reflects factors such as drought conditions in the agricultural sector and low commodity prices but also domestic structural constraints, which have discouraged investment and employment creatio Government has committed, to amongst others, a complete overhaul of the visa system to support the tourism sector, the finalisation of key mining legislation to support the mining sector and further stabilise the finances of State-owned enterprise The upcoming job and investment summits, as well as the proposed government stimulus package, will provide details on reforms needed to drive growt

src_text: iti it ego peelet o le tlhomo ya me om Mmu o o ikgafile, gareng ga t e dingwe, go beakanya leswa tshepedi o ya di-visa ka nepo ya go thekga lefapha la boeti, go felelet a melao ye bohlokwa ka nepo ya go thekga lefapha la meepo le go t wela pele go bea sekeng dit helete t a dikgwebo t a mmu
trg_text: Inspections of factories remain ongoing, according to the updated hygiene regulation Allegations of fake and expired foods1 Cabinet commends the swift action taken by the Minister of Health, Dr Aaron Motsoaledi, to look into the allegations of fake and expired foods in South Afric The DoH has received a high volume of complaints and noted concerns about unauthenticated food-related videos that are circulating on social mediaSince August, inspection blitzes have taken place at various food premises and they continue in different parts of the countryIn addition, the food industry has been requested to confirm the authenticity of potential counterfeit foodstuffs while other government regulatory authorities from the departments of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries, and Trade and Industry, including the National Consumer Commission, are involved in confirming public claims of compromised quality standard

src_text: i int wego, di tla fana ka dintlha ka ga dipeakanyoleswa t e di hlokagalago go hlohlelet a kgolo ya ekonom Kabinete e tii et a boikgafo bja mmu o bja go dira gore seemo sa dit helete se boele sekeng gomme tlhako ya dit helete ye e bu eledit wego e tla hlagi wa ka Polelong ya Pego ya Ditekanyet o t a Nako ya Magareng (MTBPS) Ketelo ya United Kingdom (UK) le Northern Ireland Kabinete e ba le Mopresidente Cyril Ramaphosa ge a amogela ketelo ya mo omo ye e atlegilego ya Tonakgolo Theresa May wa UK ya Great Britain le Northern Irelan Ketelo ye e tla t welet a dikholego t e di kaonafet ego go Afrika Borwa ka kgwebi ano le peelet o t eo di maatlafadit wego t a dinaga t e ka bobed UK ke ye nngwe ya babeelet i ba ka ntle ba bagolo ka Afrika Borwa, fao e lego gore go na le difeme t a go feta t e 650 t a Prithani ka mmarakeng wa ren Ka ditheri anong t a dinaga t e ka bobedi, go ile gwa boledi anwa ka dilekane le maitapi o ao a kgonagalag Tonakgolo May o ile a fana gape ka Nakana ya SS Mendi go Mokhomantaramogolo wa Afrika Borwa, Mopresidente Ramaphosa, le go batho ba Afrika Borwa, ka nepo ya go keteka maitapi o ao a dirilwego ke maAfrika Borwa a go feta a 600 bao ba hlokofet ego ge sekepe sa SS Mendi se nwelela ka go English Channel mo mengwageng ya go feta ye 100 ye e fetilego Seboka ka ga Tiri ano ya China le Afrika (FOCAC) Kabinete e amoget e Leanotiro la Beijing (la 2019-2021), leo le hlalo ago ka botlalo dipoelo t a Seboka sa FOCAC seo badulasetulo ba sona e bilego Mopresidente Ramaphosa le Mopresidente wa China Xi Jinpin Go aga selekane sa kakaret o sa togamaano le sa tiri ano ka ga China le Afrika, China e ikgafile go phethagat a maano a tiri ano a 10 le Afrik Wona a ka makaleng a tlhomo ya diintasteri; go beakanya temo ka mokgwa wa sebjalebjale; tlhomo ya mananeokgoparara; ditirelo t a dit helete; tlhabollo ya tikologo; go nolofat a kgwebi ano le peelet o; go fokot a bohloki le go phela gabotse ga set haba; maphelo a set haba; neelano ya batho ka batho, le khut o le t hirelet eg Ge nako e dut e e sepela, tiri ano gareng ga dinaga t e ka bobedi e tla thekgwa ke morero wa:
trg_text: United Kingdom (UK) and Northern Ireland visit Cabinet joins President Cyril Ramaphosa in welcoming the successful working visit by Prime Minister Theresa May of the UK of Great Britain and Northern Irelan It will yield improved benefits for South Africa through strengthened bilateral trade and investmen The UK is one of the largest foreign investors in South Africa, with over 650 British firms present in our marke During the bilateral engagements, potential partnerships and efforts were discusse Prime Minister May also handed over the SS Mendi Bell to South Africa s Commander-in-Chief, President Ramaphosa, and the people of South Africa, to commemorate the sacrifice of over 600 South Africans who perished when the SS Mendi sank in the English Channel over 100 years ago Forum on China-Africa Cooperation (FOCAC) Summit Cabinet considered the Beijing Action Plan (2019-2021), which details the outcomes of the FOCAC Summit co-chaired by President Ramaphosa and Chinese President Xi Jinpin To build the China-Africa comprehensive strategic and cooperative partnership, China committed to implementing 10 cooperation plans with Afric These are in the areas of industrialisation; agricultural modernisation; infrastructure; financial services; green development; trade and investment facilitation; poverty reduction and public welfare; public health; people-to-people exchanges, and peace and securit Over the period, cooperation between the two sides will be underpinned by the theme:

src_text: China le Afrika: Re lebile go set haba seo se tiilego seo se nago le bokamoso bja bohle ka go diri a tiri ano ya go hola mahlakore ka bobed 4.
trg_text: China and Africa: Towards an even stronger community with a shared future through win-win cooperatio 4.

src_text: Theko ya makhura Kabinete e amogela ditheko t a makhura t e di sego t a fetoga mo kgweding ye bjalo ka kimollo ya lebakanyana ya nako e tee fela go badiri i ba dinamelwa t a bohle, go beng ba difatanaga le go badiri i, mola e le gore magato a mangwe a sa nyakwa ke Kgoro ya Enet i (DoE).
trg_text: Fuel price Cabinet welcomes the unchanged fuel price for this month as a once-off temporary relief for users of public transport, motorists and consumers, while other measures are being sought by the Department of Energy (DoE).

src_text: Mabaka a lefaseng ka bophara go akaret wa koket ego ya theko ya oli ye tala le maikutlo a go se loke mabapi le mebaraka ye e sa t welelago di bakile gore theko ya makhura e hlatloge kudu ka Afrika Borwa go tloga ka Moranang mo ngwageng w Kabinete e hlagi it e tlhobaboroko ka ga dikoket ego t e le diabe t a go se loke go badiri i ka kakaret o, go akaret wa gareng ga t e dingwe, diabe t a mabapi le seabe sa infolei ene ka ge bat welet i ba tli a ditlhatlo o t e t a ditheko go lefapha la kgweb Go hlokomet we se, Tona ya Enet i, Morena Jeff Radebe, o dirile tsenogare ye e kgethegilego legatong la mmu o go thu a set haba kgahlanong le koket ego ye nngwe ya theko ya makhura, ka ntle le koket o ya disente t e ka litara ka theki ong ya pheterole go kgont ha koket o ya ngwaga ka ngwaga ya meputso ya ba omi, ba go swana le bat hedi ba dipeterole, ka dite eng t a go t hela makhur Ka nakong yeo ekonomi e angwago ke mathata a lefase ka bophara, Kabinete e thabile ge tsenogare ye e se na seabe go sekhwama sa dit helete ka ge e
trg_text: Cabinet has expressed concern about increases and the detrimental effects on the general consumer, including amongst others, effects relating to the inflationary impact as producers pass on the increases to the retail secto Taking this into account, the Minister of Energy, Mr Jeff Radebe, made a special intervention on behalf of government to cushion the public against yet another steep increase in the fuel price, with the exception of the cents per litre increase in the retail margin of petrol to cater for the annual salary increases of employees, such as petrol attendants, at fuel station At a time when the economy is being impacted by global headwinds, Cabinet is pleased that this intervention has no impact on the fiscus as it uses funds that are already in the fuel-pricing structure Land reform

trg_text: Cabinet calls on all South Africans to use the debate around the issue of land reform to strengthen nation-building and social cohesio The unfolding parliamentary process will bring clarity and allow us to move forward as a natio The transparent, rules-based and constitutional process is in keeping with our commitment to jointly arrive at solutions for the betterment of societ Cabinet is convinced this process will allow us to determine a land reform model that works for everyon

src_text: omi a meetse Thuto Kabinete e lebogi it e Kgoro ya Thuto ya Motheo (DBE) ge e atlegile go fana ka Sekolo sa Phoraemari sa Delft South, se se lego ka ntle ga Motsekapa ka Kapa Bodikel Sekolo se se agilwe ka go diri a Lesolo leo le Kopant wego la Kabo ya Mananeokgoparara a Dikolo (ASIDI) la kgoro ye ka tshenyegelo ya R75 milion Se na le diphapo i t a borutelo t e 45, laporathori ya dikhomphutha le ya t a mahlale, bokgobapuku gammogo le lefelo la phep Lefelo le leswa le la maemo a godimo le tla fana ka seemo se sekaone sa go ithuta le go ruta go baithuti bao ba ka bago ba 1 578 go t wa ka set habeng sa Delf Se ke sekolo sa mafelelo go dikolo t e 25 t eo di filwego mmu o wa Kapa Bodikela ka go diri a lesolo la DB Go fihla mo lebakeng le, lenaneo la ASIDI le agile dikolo t a maemo a godimo t e 205 nageng ka bophar Palomoka ya dikolo t e 685 di abet we kabo ya meetse ye e tshephagalago, dikolo t e 486 di abet we dinolofat i t e kaone t a kelelat hila mola dikolo t e 372 di kgokagant we le kabo ya mohlagase la mathomo Dikgopelo t a Setlamo sa Boset haba sa Thu o ya Dit helete t a Baithuti (NSFAS) t a 2019 Kabinete e amoget e phetolo ye kgolo go t wa go baithuti ka morago ga go bulwa semmu o ga tshepedi o ya dikgopelo t a NSFAS t a 2019 ka la 03 Lewed Baithuti bao ba dirago dikgopelo la mathomo le ba bjale ba go feta ba 45 000 ba tsene go wepsaete ya NSFAS ka let at i la mathom Kgatelopele e dirilwe go felelet a bont i bja ditefo t eo di
trg_text: Water Cabinet is pleased that the Department of Water and Sanitation has completed the construction of the Cornelis River Dam in the Free Stat The dam, which is set to benefit 2 690 households and an estimated 10 674 people, will ease water challenges faced by the community of Warden and Ezenzeleni under the Phumelela Local Municipalit South Africa is still experiencing water shortages as a result of drought conditions and Cabinet appeals to all people to use this resource sparingly and to remain water wise Education Cabinet congratulated the Department of Basic Education for successfully handing over the Delft South Primary School, outside Cape Town in the Western Cap The school was built through the department s Accelerated Schools Infrastructure Delivery Initiative (ASIDI) at a cost of R75 millio It consists of 45 classrooms, a computer and science laboratory, library as well as a nutrition centr The new state-of-the-art facilities will provide a conducive learning and teaching environment to about 1 578 learners from the Delft communit This is the final school out of 25 schools handed over to the Western Cape through the National Department of Education s initiativ To date, the ASIDI programme has built 205 state-of-the-art-schools nationall A total of 685 schools have been provided with reliable water supply, some 486 schools have been provided with decent sanitation facilities and 372 schools have been connected to the electricity grid for the first time 2019 National Student Financial Aid Scheme (NSFAS) applications Cabinet welcomed the overwhelming response from prospective students following the official opening of the 2019 NSFAS application process on 03 Septembe Over 45 000 potential and current students logged onto the NSFAS website on the first da Progress has also been made to clear the backlog of outstanding payments to student The application process is based on a new system which makes funding decisions quicker while applications are now easily filled in by students regardless of their location Listeriosis Cabinet welcomes the declaration that the Listeriosis outbreak is over and it strongly demonstrates the impact of the emergency collaborative response plan by the Department of Health (DoH) and the National Institute for Communicable Diseases, supported by the World Health Organisation, to control and end the outbrea The DoH has put in place a surveillance system to prevent a recurrenc All factories that make ready-to-eat processed meat and chicken need to have food safety management systems in place, according to Regulation R607 published on 14 June 2018.

src_text: alet ego morago go ya go baithut Tshepedi o ya dikgopelo e theilwe go lenaneo le leswa leo le dirago gore go t ea diphetho t a thu o ya ma eleng go be ka pela mola e le gore diforomo t a dikgopelo bjale di tlat wa gabonolo ke baithuti go sa kgathale gore ba kae Listeriosis Kabinete e amogela tsebi o ya gore leuba la Listeriosis le fedile gomme se se laet a ka maatla seabe seo se dirilwego ke leanophetolo la tiri ano leo le t welelago le dirwago ke Kgoro ya Maphelo (DoH) le Sehlongwa sa Boset haba sa Malwet i a go Fetela, gomme di thekgilwe ke Mokgatlo wa t a Maphelo wa Lefase, go laola le go fedi a leuba l DoH e tsent e tiri ong lenaneo la tekodi i o la go thibela gore leuba le le hlage gap Difeme ka moka t eo di dirago nama ye khubedu le ya kgogo t eo di loket ego go jewa semeetseng di swanet e go ba le mananeo a taolo ya polokego dijong, go latela Molawana wa R607 wo o phatlaladit wego ka la 14 Phupu 2018.
trg_text: has been used by social media to refer to food that does not contain food substancesCabinet reiterates calls on members of society to produce tangible evidence of foodstuff made from potentially harmful substances and chemicalsFurthermore, Cabinet condemns attacks on and looting of shops as a response to the sale of suspicious food Such criminal acts will not be tolerated and Law-enforcement agencies will not hesitate to arrest and prosecute persons found inciting or carrying out these criminal act Cabinet urges members of the public who are aware of suspicious foods to call the DoH hotline on 011 386 2003/6 and the National Consumer Commission hotline on 012 428 700.

src_text: Ditlhahlobo t a difeme t e di sa t wela pele, go latela melawana ya pabalelo ya maphelo yeo e mpshafadit weg Dipolelo mabapi le dijo t a bofora le t eo di felet wego ke nako1 Kabinete e reta kgato ya ka pela ye e dirilwego ke Tona ya Maphelo, Ngaka Aaron Motsoaledi, go lebeledi i a dipolelo t a mabapi le dijo t a bofora le t eo di felet wego ke nako ka Afrika Borw DoH e amoget e palo ya godimo ya dingongorego gomme ya lemoga dipelaelo t a mabapi le dibitio ka ga dijo t eo di sego t a tii et wa t eo di phatlalet ego go kga o ya set habaGo tloga ka Phato, masolo a tlhahlobo ya dijo a dirilwe mafelong a mehutahuta a dijo gomme a sa t wela pele ka dikarolong t e di fapafapanego t a nagaGodimo ga fao, intasteri ya dijo e kgopet e go tii et a bonnete bja kgonagalo ya dijo t a bofora mola e le gore ba taolo ya dijo ba mmu o go t wa ka go kgoro ya Temo, Kagodithokgwa le Boreahlapi, le Kgoro ya Kgwebi ano le Diintasteri, go akaret wa Khomi ene ya Badiri i ya Boset haba (NCC), di kgatha tema go tii et a seo se bolelwago ke set haba sa gore maemo a hlwahlwa ya dijo a beilwe kotsingKabinete e ipilet a go set haba gore se nt he mahlo dinameng mareong a farologanego a amanago le dijo:Lereo la best-before date le ra bophelo bjo botelele bja go ba
trg_text: Cabinet approved the publication of the White Paper on Science, Technology and Innovation of 2018, for public commen The Minister of Science and Technology, Ms Mmamoloko Kubayi-Ngubane, will provide a full briefing in due course Cabinet also approved the publication of the National Protected Areas Expansion Strategy (NPAES) for public commen The NPAES is a 20-year strategic plan aligned to the NDP, focusing on expanding the protected areas estate, with specific focus on economic growth, transformation and sustainabilit The NPAES highlights how scarce human and financial resources can be efficiently and effectively allocated to achieve cost-effective protected area expansion, ecological sustainability and resilience to climate chang South Africa s protected area network includes world heritage sites, national parks, nature reserves, special nature reserves, protected environments, marine protected areas, mountain catchment areas, specially protected forest areas, and forest nature reserves Cabinet approved South Africa s Negotiating Positions for the 13th Meeting of the Conference of Contracting Parties to the Ramsar Convention on Wetlands (Ramsar COP 13) to be held in Dubai, United Arab Emirates, from 21 to 29 October 2011.

trg_text: 1 Cabinet appeals to the public to be vigilant in differentiating terms related to food:The best-before date refers to the long shelf life of dry and canned products, and is not an indicator of safetThe sell-by date is used for perishable food usually stored in a refrigerator and from July this year became no longer relevant, according to global authoritie The use-by or expiry date is the expiry date and means that food bearing this mark is no longer palatable after this dat For perishable food, this means it can no longer be consume Counterfeit goods

trg_text: In 2016 and 2017, the Department of Public Service and Administration identified public-service employees registered as suppliers on the Central Supplier Database, as supplied by National Treasur Departments were requested to create awareness, to verify information and to report progress with implementation on the steps taken against transgressor By the end of April 2018, 96% of all SMS members submitted their disclosures using the eDisclosure System Cabinet was briefed on progress made on the National School of Government (NSG) Funding Mode Cabinet approved a suit of mandatory and compulsory training programmes to be piloted by the NSG to undertake rapid capacity development interventions and to professionalize the public servic The direct payment for compulsory programmes to the NSG by relevant employing departments from their training budgets was also approve This will lead to a developmental public administration that goes further in attaining Vision 2030 of the NDP by

src_text: omi it we ke kga o ya set haba go ra dijo t eo di se nago le ditswaki t a dijoKabinete e bu elet a boipilet o go maloko a set haba go tli a bohlatse bjo bo kwagalago bja dijo t eo di dirilwego ka ditswaki le dikhemikhale t eo di ka bago kotsiGodimo ga fao, Kabinete e kgalema ditlhaselo le go t ea dithoto ka mabenkeleng ka kgang bjalo ka phetolo go theki o ya dijo t e di belaet ag Ditiro t a bosenyi t a mohuta woo di ka se kgotlelelwe gomme ditheo t a phethagat o ya molao di ka se dikadike go golega le go seki a batho bao ba hwet wago ba hlohlelet a le go dira ditiro t e t a boseny Kabinete e ipilet a go maloko a set haba bao ba tsebago ka ga dijo t eo di belaet ago go let et a mogala wa t hoganet o wa go se lefelwe wa DoH go 011 386 2003/6 le go NCC go 012 428 700.
trg_text: Thuma Mina: Taking Public Services to the People , provides another platform for government to take public services to the peopl Thusong Service Centres are one-stop centres for access to government services and information, and the 133 Thusong Service Centres countrywide are centres of hope, access, redress, equality and empowerment for those previously marginalised from the mainstream of socio-economic developmen Government is working on installing a Queue Management System that will reduce the process flow to enable reduction in waiting tim The system will be installed in all centres countrywide with focus also on information and communications technology (ICT) connectivity, which is an enabler for service delivery 2018 ITU Telecom World Conference Cabinet welcomes the 2018 International Telecommunication Union (ITU) Telecom World Conference in Durban from 10 to 13 September 2018, under the theme

src_text: Tefo ya dit helete t a thu o ya leago1 Kabinete e amogela pego ya kgatelopele ye e dirilwego ke Tona ya Tlhabollo ya Leago Susan Shabangu, ka ga tiri ano gareng ga Setheo sa T hirelet o ya t a Leago sa Afrika Borwa (SASSA) le Tirelo ya Poso ya Afrika Borwa (SAPO) go t ea ditefelo t a dit helete t a thu o ya leago go Cash Paymaster Services go tloga ka la 1 Diphalane 201 SASSA go fihla mo lebakeng le e tlo it e tiri ong dikarata t a kgale t e di ka bago t e dimilione t e hlano le seripa ya tsenya dikarata t e diswa t a SASSA gold card gomme t e diketekete di sa swanet e go feto w Kabinete e ipilet a ka maatla go beng ba dikarata t a kgale t a SASSA go di feto aSAPO e tla thoma go lefa khe e go baamogedi bao ba palet wego ke go nt ha t helete go di-ATM goba ka mabenkelen Go hwet a tshedimo o ka botlalo, baholegi ba dit helete t a thu o ya leago ba ka let et a nomoro ya go se lefelwe ya SASSA go 0800 60 10 11 ka diiri t a mo om Kotsi ya Setimela1 Kabinete e lakalet a banamedi bao ba gobet ego ge ditimela t e pedi t a Metrorail di thulana ka Eloff Extension ka Selby, ka borwa bja Johannesburg, gore ba fole ka pela ebile e ipilet a gore dinyaki i o ka ga seo se bakilego kotsi ye di akgofi we go thibela gore kotsi ya mohuta wo e hlage gap Diphetho t a Kabinete1.
trg_text: 1 SASSA has so far replaced about five and a half million old cards with the new SASSA gold card but thousands still need to be exchange Cabinet strongly appeals to holders of old cards to make the switchSAPO will also take over the payment of cash to those recipients who were unable to withdraw cash from ATMs or merchant For further information, social-grant beneficiaries can call the SASSA toll-free number on 0800 60 10 11 during office hour Train accident1 Cabinet wishes the commuters who were injured when two Metrorail trains collided at the Eloff Extension in Selby, south of Johannesburg, a speedy recovery and calls for the investigation into the cause of the accident to be fast-tracked to prevent a recurrenc Cabinet decisions1.

src_text: Kabinete e dumelet e go lokollwa ga Dipalopalo ka ga Bosenyi t a Boset haba t a 2017/18 ke Tirelo ya Maphodisa ya Afrika Borwa (SAPS).
trg_text: Cabinet approved for the release of the 2017/18 National Crime Statistics by the South African Police Servic The annual crime statistics enable government to monitor key targets, in particular the reduction of reported serious crimes, as set out in the Medium Term Strategic Framework 2014-2019.

src_text: Dipalopalo ka ga Bosenyi t a ngwaga ka ngwaga di kgont ha mmu o go hlokomela mafelo ao bosenyi bo tlet ego go ona, kudukudu go fokot eng ga bosenyi bjo bo oro bjo bo begilwego, ka ge go hlalo it we ka go Tlhako ya Togamaano ya Lebaka la Magareng ya 2014-2019.
trg_text: Progress has been made in terms of implementing Regulation 13(c) of the Public Service Regulations (PSR) of 2016, which prohibits public-service employees from conducting business with an organ of state, as well as Regulation 18 of the PSR of 2016, which requires members of the Senior Management Service (SMS) to disclose their financial and other private interest Cabinet also approved that relevant Executive Authority of government departments should monitor implementation of Regulation 13(c) of the PSR of 2016, take appropriate disciplinary steps and submit a report thereof to the Minister of Public Service and Administration (MPSA) by the end of each financial yea The first report is due for submission to the MPSA by the 31 March 2013.

src_text: Dipalopalo ka ga bosenyi di ka
trg_text: Issues in the environment1.

src_text: omi wa gape bjalo ka dilaet i t a temo o ya ka pela go maatlafat a masolo a thibelo ya bosenyi le ditogamaano t a dikgoro t a mmu o t a mehutahuta Kabinete e sedimo it we ka ga kgatelopele ye e dirilwego ka taolong ya maitshwaro a ba omi ba mmu o bao ba dirago kgwebo le setheo sa mmu
trg_text: Cabinet congratulates Caster Semenya on her impressive performance in winning her third Diamond League final in the 800 metre event in Switzerlan AppointmentsAll appointments are subject to the verification of qualifications and the relevant clearancMr Jacob Ganny Mbele as the Deputy Director-General (DDG): Energy Programmes and Projects in the Do Ms Hilda Dikeledi Mhlongo as the DDG: Corporate Services in the DoNon-executive directors on the Land and Agricultural Development Bank Board of Directors:Adv Sandra Coetzee (reappointment); andMs Mathane Eveline MakgathEnquiries:Ms Phumla Williams, Acting Cabinet SpokespersonCell: 083 501 0139

src_text: Go t wet a pele ditiro t e di lokilego le t e kaone ka ba omi ba mmu o ba maemo a godingwana ke karolo ye bohlokwa ya go aga mmu o wa go hloka sephiri le wa maikarabelo, ka ge go ukangwe ka go Molaotheo wa Repabliki ya Afrika Borwa wa 1996 le go agwa ga mmu o wa bokgoni ka ge go ukangwe ka go Leanotlhabollo la Boset haba (NDP): Nepong ya 2031.
trg_text: Cabinet was briefed on progress made in the management of discipline of public-service employees conducting business with an organ of stat Promoting just and fair administration actions by senior government officials is a critical part of building an open and accountable government, as envisaged in the Constitution of the Republic of South Africa of 1996 and the building of a capable state as envisioned in the National Development Plan (NDP): Vision 2031.

src_text: Go bile le kgatelopele mabapi le go tsenya tiri ong ga Molawana wa 13(c) wa Melaotshepet o ya Tirelo ya Set haba (PSR) ya 2016, yeo e ilet ago ba omi ba mmu o go dira kgwebo le setheo sa mmu o, gammogo le Molaotshepet o wa 18 wa PSR wa 2016, wo o nyakago gore maloko a Tirelo ya Taolo a Godingwana (SMS) a tsebagat e Dikgahlego t a bona t a dit helete le t e dingwe t a phraebet Kabinete e dumelet e gape gore Bolaodiphethi i bja maleba bja dikgoro t a mmu o bo swanet e go hlokomela go tsenywa tiri ong ga Molaotshepet o wa 13(c) wa PSR wa 2016, bo t eye dikgato t a maleba t a kgalemo le go romela pego go Tona ya Kgoro ya Tirelo ya Set haba le Taolo (DPSA) mafelelong a ngwaga o mongwe le o mongwe wa dit helet Pego ya mathomo e tla romelwa go DPSA pele la 31 Hlakola 2019 le dikel Ka 2016 le 2017, DPSA e hwedit e ba omi ba mmu o bao ba ngwadi it wego bjalo ka baabi ba ditirelo le dithoto ka go Lenaneo la Bogareng la Baabi la Ditirelo le Dithoto (CSD), ka ge le abja ke Kgoro ya Dit helete ya Boset hab Dikgoro di ile t a kgopelwa go dira temo o, go tii et a tshedimo o le go fa pego ka ga phethagat o ya magato ao a t erwego kgahlanong le bao ba tshelago molao w Go ya mafelelong a Moranang ka 2018, 96% ya maloko ka moka a SMS a romet e ditsebagat o t a bona ba
trg_text: Cabinet approved publication of the Compensation for Occupational Injuries and Disease Amendment Bill of 2018 for public commen The Bill, which amends the Compensation for Occupational Injuries and Diseases Act, 1993 (Act 130 of 1993) recognises domestic workers, who were excluded from the Act, as employees for the purpose of benefits, as well as improving existing benefit The amendments improve the benefits payable to employees and their dependents, and aim to assist injured and diseased employees to be rehabilitated and reintegrated into the workplace and society Cabinet approved the introduction of the Child Justice Amendment Bill of 2018 into Parliamen The Bill amends the Child Justice Act, 2008 (Act 75 of 2008) in order to review the minimum age of criminal capacity of a child by increasing it from the age of 10 to 12 year The Bill goes further in upholding the rights of children in conflict with the la The Bill also de-links the issue of criminal capacity from diversion, by removing the requirement to prove criminal capacity for purposes of diversion and preliminary inquiries Cabinet approved submission of the Civil Aviation Amendment Bill of 2018 to Parliamen The Bill, which amends the Civil Aviation Act, 2009 (Act 13 of 2009), will strengthen the aviation safety, security and environmental protection regulatory frameworks to ensure sustainability and stability of the civil-aviation industr This will ensure that South Africa continues to meet her international obligations in the civil-aviation arena, which strengthens support to our economic development as a catalyst for increased trade, tourism and job creatio The Bill also provides for, amongst others, the operational independence of the aircraft accident and incident investigation, and to rectify inconsistencies and shortcoming Upcoming events1.

src_text: omi a Lenaneo la eDisclosure Kabinete e sedimo it we ka ga kgatelopele ye e dirilwego ka ga Mokgwa wa Thu o ya Dit helete go Sekolo sa Boset haba sa Mmu o (NSG).
trg_text: Payment of social grants1 Cabinet welcomes the progress report by Social Development Minister, Susan Shabangu, on the partnership between South African Social Security Agency (SASSA) and the South African Post Office (SAPO) to take over the payments of social grants from Cash Paymaster Services with effect from 1 October 2018.

src_text: Kabinete e dumelet e gore sehlopha sa mananeotlhahlo a semolao le a kgapelet o se lekwe ke NSG ka nepo ya go dira ditsenogare t a tlhabollo ya bokgoni t e di tsenelet ego le go dira gore tirelo ya set haba e be ya sephrofe enal Tefothwii ya mananeo a kgapelet o ka go NSG ke dikgoro t a maleba t a ba omi go t wa go ditekanyet o t a t ona t a tlhahlo ya ba omi le yona e ile ya dumelelw Se se tla felet a ka taolo ya lekala la set haba leo le hlabollago le le t welago pele go fihlelela Nepo ya 2030 ya NDP ka go
trg_text: The event, which is coming to Africa for the first time, provides an opportunity for increased participation of African countries towards bolstering ICT in Africa as a driver of development and innovatio The annual conference attracts more than 9 000 delegates from around the world, with government and industry leaders exploring and identifying investment opportunities and best practices for socio-economic development through IC Key issues for discussion include: 5G for smarter digital development, collaborating on cybersecurity, digital financial services and satellites for a smarter digital developmen The ITU Telecom World Conference 2018 is hosted at a time when South Africa is implementing key national projects which include the National e-Government Strategy focusing on digital transformation of government services and the National ICT Small, Medium and Micro Enterprises (SMME) Support Strategy, which seeks to unlock the potential of the South African ICT SMMEs secto These tools are creating an enabling environment for the sector s growth and ensuring their sustainabilit Messages1.

src_text: aga mmu o wo o nago le bokgoni le wa tlhabolllo, leo ge re
trg_text: By working together, we can build a better nation where the dreams and aspirations of all our people are realise

src_text: oma mmogo le badudi bao ba kgathago tema, le etago pele lesolo la go se tekateke kgahlanong le bohloki, tlhokego ya me omo le tlhokego ya tekatekano set haben 4.
trg_text: The broad objectives of the Ramsar Convention are to ensure the conservation and wise use of all wetland In South Africa, wetlands are the most threatened of all ecosystems, with 48% of them critically endangere This contributes to water resources management as part of a proactive approach to drought managemen Bills1.

src_text: Kabinete e dumelet e go phatlalat wa ga Pampiri ya Ditheri ano ka ga Mahlale, Theknolot i le Boitlhamelo ya 2018, gore set haba se fe ditshwaotshwao ka ga yon Tona ya Mahlale le Theknolot i, Mohumagadi Mmamoloko Kubayi-Ngubane, o tla fana ka tshedimo o ka botlalo ge nako e dut e e sepela Kabinete e dumelet e gape go phatlalat wa ga Leano la Boset haba la Katolo o ya Mafelo ao a
trg_text: President Ramaphosa joined other African leaders in Harare to witness the occasio Cabinet supports President Ramaphosa s commitment to work closely with Zimbabwe to enhance the historical, political and fraternal relations, with particular emphasis on strengthening economic cooperatio Cabinet commends the Council for Scientific and Industrial Research, and specifically its female researchers, on health research being undertaken to improve the country s healthcare syste These include: (i) a diabetes-detecting chip to monitor blood sugar levels by analysing breath; (ii) development of probiotics for use in the production of broiler chickens, dusky-cob and abalone, which will assist in the production of natural animal products, free of antibiotics, chemicals and growth stimulants; (iii) and further stem cell researc Cabinet also congratulates Dr Evodia Setati, a senior researcher at the University of Stellenbosch s Department of Viticulture and Oenology, who won the Distinguished Women Scientists Award at the annual South African Women in Science Awards held in Polokwane on 23 August 2014.

src_text: ireledit wego (NPAES) gore set haba se fe ditshwaotshwao ka ga lon NPAES ke leanotiro la mengwaga ye 20 leo le sepelelanago le NDP, gomme le lebelet e kudu go katolo a mafelo a bohwa ao a
trg_text: From the expenditure side, net exports recorded a strong recovery, however this was offset by a contraction in household expenditure and very large draw down in inventorie Investment growth by private companies increased, while investment by the public sector contracte The rising volatility in global markets and the GDP outcome require that government accelerates efforts to unblock constraints to economic growth while providing support to vulnerable group

src_text: ireledit wego, go lebelet we kudu kgolo ya ekonomi, diphetogo le t welo pele go ya go il NPAES e hlalo a ka boripana ka fao methopo ya ba omi le ya dit helete yeo e hlaelelago e ka abjago gabotse ntle le mathata go fihlelela katolo o ya mafelo ao a
trg_text: Congratulations Cabinet congratulated the people of Zimbabwe for successfully transitioning into a new government led by President Emmerson Mnangagwa, who was inaugurated on 26 August 2018.

src_text: ireledit wego ya go seket a t helete, phedi ano ya diphedi ya go ya go ile le go kgotlelela phetogo ya tlelaemet Lenaneokgoparara la Afrika Borwa la mafelo ao a
trg_text: Cabinet affirms government s commitment to fiscal sustainability and a revised fiscal framework will be presented in the Medium Term Budget Policy Statement
